document_title: Angina: A warning sign of a potential heart attack
subsection_content:
Angina is often the "source" of heart diseases. According to cardiovascular experts, lifestyle changes do not help relieve angina immediately. But in the long run, this will be an important step to help you prevent the occurrence of angina. Here are healthy methods you should apply every day:
Relax and rest, avoid heavy work or exertion to keep your heart healthy.; Avoid stress and prolonged stress, keep a comfortable mind; Build a scientific diet, eat lots of vegetables, fiber, and fish. Limit eating fat, salty foods, lots of sweets, especially fried foods, etc.; Quit smoking, stop drinking alcohol, try to lose weight if you are overweight or obese.; Treatment of diseases that cause angina such as high blood pressure, diabetes, dyslipidemia, etc.; Exercise regularly, at least 30 minutes a day with moderate exercises such as yoga, walking, cycling, etc.; Use medication as prescribed by your doctor to control blood pressure, cholesterol, blood sugar...; Build a habit of regular health check-ups, doing electrocardiograms, echocardiograms, blood pressure measurements, etc. every 6 months.
Master and doctor Pham Do Anh Thu said that to have a healthy heart, people at high risk of cardiovascular disease or with symptoms of angina need to see a doctor early for timely treatment. .
